_header: Saint Francis the friar minor that was good man enough
Subjects: saints’ lives; Francis of Assisi, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Francis in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Frances þe frere menour good mon was InouȝIn is
                    ȝonghede marchaunt he was & to trewenesse dron…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& beþ þer boþe two In Ioie wiþþoute
                    endeNou god uor loue of hem ous late þuder wende
BodAsh43.Editions:
Whatley,  Gordon E.,
                        ed.  
             Saints’ Lives in Middle English Collections.
         With Anne B. Thompson and Robert K. Upchurch. MI: Western Michigan
            University for TEAMS, 2004.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint ffraunceis þe ffrere Menour þat good mon was i
                    nouhIn his ȝonghede Marchaunt he was and to trewenesse
                    drouh…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þis holy mon at stod a while and þouȝte hem sum
                    good techeAnd as hit were men of witte þis foules he gon
                    preche…
BodEngPoeta1.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss of folios 57-64.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint fraunceys þe frere Menour þat guod man was i
                    novȝMarchaunt he was in his ȝonghede and to eche treuwenesse
                    drovȝ…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…And þare huy boþe in Ioye with outen endeNou god
                    for þe loue of Seint fraunceis late us alle þudere wende.
                    Amen
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 53-67.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Seyn fraunceys þe frer menor þat gode man inoghIn hiis
                    ȝyngthe a merchand was to godenes ay he droghHiis marchandis he made
                    all day in þe cite of assiseIn almusdede & pore men he spend hiis
                    marchandise…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Þere are ye both in ioy & myrthe sall last wyth owten
                    endeGod grant vs for þe lufe of þem vnto þat blys to
                    wende

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint ffraunces þe frere Menour goed man was ynowIn his
                    Yonghede Marchaunt he was & to alle truþe drow…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…And beoþ þere in ioye ynow wiþ oute eny
                    endeNow god ffor þe loue of ham lete vs alle þuder
                    wende

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEynt fraunces þe frere mynour þat goude man was
                    ynoweMarchaunt he was þe wyle he ȝonge was & to eche
                    gouernesse drowe…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& beþ þer boþ two in Ioie with þouten
                    endeNow god for loue of seint fraunces late ous þydere
                    wende

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEin franceis þe frere menour god man was ynouIn his ȝonghede marchaunt he was & treunesse drou…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& beþ þere boþe to in ioie wit outen endenou god for þe loue of hom ous lete alle þuþer wende
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxv” added to right margin by later hand (f. 140).

BLEge2891.Last Lines: …And beoþ þere boþe to In ioie wiþ oute endeNou god for þe loue of hom us alle lete þuder wende

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt ffraunceys þe frere menour gode man was ynouȝIn ys ȝonghede marchaunt was & to trewnesse drouȝ…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …& beþ boþe to in ioie wiþ outen endeNou god for þe lous of hym vs lete alle þider wende

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt ffraunces þe frere Menour þat gode mon was
                    ynoghMerchaunt he was whyle he was ȝonge & to all godenes
                    drogh…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…And ben þere boþe two in þe ioye withouten
                    endeNow god for þe love of saynt fraunces graunte vs þider to
                    wende Amen
